title: Riot, I think your match making system is broken.
body:
Ranked Season Wide Win ratio's only.  Not per champion - Season Wide.

Team 1: My Team
**Top: Win Ratio 26%**
JG: Win Ratio 63%  (Me)
**MID: Win Ratio 14%**
ADC: Win Ratio 50%
SUPP: Win Ratio 49%

Average Win Ratio:  40%

Team 2: Enemy Team
Top: Win Ratio 42%
JG: Win Ratio 55%
MID: Win Ratio 53%
ADC: Win Ratio 52%
SUPP: Win Ratio 52%

Average Win Ratio: 51%

**Why is the MMR system allowing these types of match ups?  It would seem the system is completely useless since 70% of the players are all in the same MMR bracket... and the algorithm doesn't seem to be able to match players with like skills together.**

How is it right to put a person with a 63% win ratio season wide with a person who has a 14% win ratio ... or a 26% win ratio.  So Tilted.

replies.body: the matchmaking is god awful. either the game is dying and they don't have enough players to provide 50/50 games, or the team in charge of matchmaking just sucks and needs to go back to college.

i looked at op.gg i see nothing wrong.

dude. look at the amount of games. like i can count the number of games on my hands its so little.

i mean tbh they probably should stop playing ranked for the day. But matchmaking wise, nothing wrong.

care to elaborate what you are seeing?  I'm interested to know how you see nothing wrong?

**Viewing the 26% win ratio**.  This person came out of Promo's as silver ... even though they won 1/10 games ( 10% ) ... and they had never had a previous MMR to boost them.  (I could see it if they were gold 2 last season.... and now they are silver ... but this is a brand new account.

Viewing the 14% win ratio.  This person is in promos's has only won 1/7 games.  How is this player not being pushed toward bronze level games?  

This is my very point.  How is the match making system working ... if people have this low of a win ratio... and are still being placed with players who have a high win ratio?  Shouldn't the system be moving players with this poor of a win rate to bronze level games?  

Also, if the system is working ... why am I placed with Gold players 2 games prior to this game....  ( And I didn't lose any games in between to be dropped down in MMR )

Because matchmaker does not care about you or your individual games. Get shafted with bad teammates? bummer, they are in that mmr and their MMR is lowerd for the loss.  Ultimately Their bad win rates will result in them no longer being in the MMR you play at.

And I agree with what you are saying - but what I am bitching about is ... because Riot is willing to place Silvers and Bronzes together regardless of MMR ... and 70% of the community is in Bronze or Silver... the MMR only really works for Plat + Players.  Everyone else is just in this GIGANTIC bracket.

You tell me. How does a 0% (26 games) winrate Annie get to Bronze 3 without winning a single game?

You start higher then bronze 3, Your starting point is not bronze 5.  She did not climb to bronze 3 she fell to it. Divisions do not accurately reflect a players assigned mmr.  Shes losing MMR from where she started.

> [{quoted}](name=Kai Guy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MOEmWVtV,comment-id=00010001000000000000,timestamp=2018-05-24T21:02:47.080+0000)

You completely missed the point. You can start from starting MMR and still end up Bronze V. You need to work on your logic. You don't know as much as you want to believe you do.

What point?
 MMR is directly tied to wins or losses. Que dodge, Ranked Decay, punishments, 0 affect on mmr.
 In my fist post I'm point out that some one in a MMR bracket with a **sustained **terrible win % will enough losses to drop their personal MMR out of that bracket, even if you never get any better they still will drop to a point you wont ever see them again. Its not to say that a overall win% on  account determines the MMR for any one account as there only so much value to gain per match. a 100% win rate with 1 game has only earned a single win worth of MMR.  When im talking about win rates over time the assumption is this is for a player who is still actively playing games because its impossible for an account to change their MMR when they don't play and obviously a inactive account is never a factor in anyone's games.


Some people place b5... Yea? some players go 0-10 and place silver or gold. some go 6-4 and place b5. You should be aware that they only do a soft reset, previous season and preseason influence your start point, its just new accounts that have the same start, its commonly accepted that's in silver mmr. You can look at a player after placements, know a rough trend of if their MMR went up or down from their 10 games, then have an estimate about what their starting point was. if they 0-10, their start was higher then the division they placed into. You have to treat it on a case to case. When I say you start higher then b3, I mean that exclusively for the very first games of ranked you play on a unranked account. Each season after starting mmr for that season is person to person, but the first time you adventure into ranked your starting above bronze.


Before any one goes, "well MMR should be the same gains for every match"  No... that's not how elo works. A favored player gains less and loses more.


HOW DID ANNIE PLACE X.  well she had enough MMR in her pool that their terrible loss streak she did not get placed in bronze 5. Its not like she's Gaining MMR for her losses.
I don't know why you cant look at the end result to figure out what happened. This player has lost X games, Losing games = losing mmr. The players MMR is hidden, Their division and LP don't  reflect what the current MMR of a player is. If a Player loses 26 games and has only fallen to bronze 3, it does not mean their MMR is bronze 3, its likely lower because MMR changes more rapidly then LP. It clearly means that the player did not place in bronze 5 after promo games. This is not to say that player does not belong in bronze 5 mmr.   You don't seem to have a realistic expectation of how many games team biased elo systems need to function properly for players not in the majority MMR.

If this was true ...  ( which it isnt ) and I will explain why.

He and I both started with the same MMR ( brand new accounts ) - neither of us used a duo to boost our MMR high.  The difference between his Placements and mine.  I won 9/10 placements .... he won 1/10 placements.... I kept a pretty good win ratio ( think im around 66% currently .... while they are at 14 and 26.  As i stated before ... I could understand this if he was plat last season and he is on the move downward from a really high MMR.  But that is not the case. - Review both accounts.  It literally makes no sense.
{{champion:84}} "When will the matchmaking ever find true balance?"
For my first promo game into Gold V I had to lane against a plat 2 Vel'Koz main.  Matchmaking is perfect, whatever do you mean?
You want matchmaking to consider winrates instead of actual ranks? Because if so, that sounds like a terrible idea.

that is not what i said - I am asking how someone with a terrible win ratio can keep such a high MMR for so long.  It does not make sense.  Bronze MMR ranges from 0 to 1150.  How come we are only utilizing 985 - 1150 for bronze.  the MMR ranges for bronze and silver should be much bigger as to split the players better.  You should lose more MMR when you lose - and you should gain more MMR when you win.

This will put people in appropriate ranges much quicker.

But you didn't give us the amount of games you played. Just some random winrates. If someone has a shitty winrate over 100+ games then it might be a boosted account or something. Just because you ended up playing with two bad players doesn't mean the entire match making system is broken.

And if you're asking for a division below bronze then Rito has got your back with the upcoming ranked changes to season 8. I've always felt like the entire mmr system is a bit wanky anyway, so I feel like it will be a nice change.

I know its a bit late ... but i am not really asking for a rank below bronze ... im asking for there to actually be a bronze win ratio.  Currently only 10% of players are bronze ... while nearly 60% are silver.  25% gold ... then plat / diamond are about 4 - 5 %

It shouldnt be like that ... it should be more like 40% bronze / 30% silver / 25% gold .....

If that was your point all along then I completely missed it. Whatever, I would agree with that. Riot also confirmed that they are making a new tier for next ranked season, hopefully something between bronze and silver, or silver and gold to spread things out a bit. Not sure if that would solve the problem, but hopefully it will help.

Also according to leagueofgraphs, 17% of players are bronze, 47% are silver, 24% are gold and the rest are plat+. So if silver gets split up into two divisions, they would each have around 23,5% of players, which is a lot more acceptable imo.
